skill.description: Access ClinPGx pharmacogenomics data (successor to PharmGKB). Query gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, allele functions, for precision medicine and genotype-guided dosing decisions.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate pharmacogenomics API client skill. All network requests target the public ClinPGx API at api.clinpgx.org. Static findings are false positives: markdown documentation examples with curl commands flagged as 'shell backtick execution'; 'CYP' gene symbols flagged as 'weak crypto'; pharmacogenomics terminology flagged as 'C2 keywords'. No credential access, no external command execution, no data exfiltration.

content.value_statement: ClinPGx provides curated pharmacogenomics data for gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, and allele function information. Access this data to support precision medicine decisions and genotype-guided dosing recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Query gene information including function, variants, and clinical significance
Search drug and chemical compounds with pharmacogenomic annotations
Retrieve CPIC clinical practice guidelines for gene-drug pairs
Get allele function definitions and population frequency data
Access clinical annotations filtered by evidence level
Retrieve regulatory drug labels with pharmacogenomic content
limitations: Rate limited to 2 requests per second (500ms delay required)
No authentication required but substantial use requires contacting api@clinpgx.org
API endpoints may change during development - monitor for updates

use_cases.title: Review Drug-Gene Interactions

use_cases.title: Analyze Population Frequencies
use_cases.description: Query allele frequencies across ethnic populations for pharmacogenomic research studies.

use_cases.description: Integrate ClinPGx data into electronic health record systems for clinical decision support tools.

prompt_templates.title: Gene Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ClinPGx database to retrieve information about the [GENE_SYMBOL] gene including its function, clinical significance, and related drugs.

prompt_templates.title: Drug Interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: Query ClinPGx for all gene-drug pairs involving [DRUG_NAME] and list their CPIC recommendation levels.

prompt_templates.title: CPIC Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the CPIC guideline for [GENE] and [DRUG] including dosing recommendations by phenotype.

prompt_templates.title: Allele Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Get all alleles for [GENE] with their function status and population frequencies across European, African, East Asian, and Latino groups.

output: CYP2C19: Cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

Clinical significance: Reduced activation in PM/IM phenotypes

output_examples.input: What alleles does CYP2D6 have and their frequencies?
output: CYP2D6*1: Normal function, 42% European, 37% African, 50% East Asian
CYP2D6*4: No function, 20% European, 5% African, 1% East Asian
CYP2D6*10: Decreased function, 2% European, 48% East Asian, 4% African

best_practices: Implement 500ms delay between API requests to comply with rate limits
Cache frequently accessed data to reduce API calls and improve performance
Check evidence levels before clinical application - prioritize Level 1A annotations
anti_patterns: Ignoring CPIC recommendation levels when making dosing decisions
Using outdated PharmGKB URLs instead of ClinPGx endpoints
Applying population frequency data without considering study limitations

faq.question: Is ClinPGx the same as PharmGKB?
faq.answer: ClinPGx is the successor to PharmGKB. All PharmGKB URLs now redirect to ClinPGx pages as of July 2025.

faq.question: What is the rate limit for API access?
faq.answer: Maximum 2 requests per second. Implement 500ms delay between requests and use exponential backoff for 429 errors.

faq.question: Can I use this skill in clinical practice?
faq.answer: Use CPIC Level A recommendations for clinical decisions. Lower evidence levels require careful interpretation and correlation with clinical judgment.

faq.question: Is patient data sent to ClinPGx?
faq.answer: No. This skill only queries public pharmacogenomics data. Patient genotype data remains local and is not transmitted.

faq.question: What genes are most commonly queried?
faq.answer: CYP2D6, CYP2C19, CYP2C9, TPMT, DPYD, SLCO1B1, and HLA-B are frequently queried for clinical pharmacogenomics.

faq.question: How does this compare to PharmGKB?
faq.answer: ClinPGx consolidates data from PharmGKB, CPIC, PharmCAT, and DPWG into a unified API with improved access and documentation.
